job_title: Mental Health Technician in Charleston, SC
pros: Working with the patients, some good coworkers, experience in the mental health field
cons:
While working here I saw improper restraints, unsafe working conditions, psychiatrists who didn’t know the names of their patients. Nurses who clearly did not due very well in nursing school. Emotional/verbal abuse by staff toward patients of all ages, staff with a huge power complex, neglect, patients going days wearing the same dirty clothes because the hospital was out of sizes, gossip, some staff openly commenting they “don’t care about the patients.” 

I had to buy materials and spend money on things out of my own pocket. There is also little to no training on how to run daily group sessions with patients. These patients are people from terrible circumstances, who have PTSD, who are in need of the most acute care. And they are not receiving the help they need, not in the slightest.

Most of the patients admitted here are involuntary. Unfortunately that leads to them being treated poorly because either way, they are viewed as an insurance check rather than a person in need of help. A dollar sign rather than a person. The goal is to get them in and out, and bill their insurance every time. Don’t be fooled. 

There are some great staff who truly want to help and do their best. But there are plenty others who are there for a paycheck and just to socialize/gossip with their coworkers. It’s a toxic work environment. There is physical neglect going on here as well, especially on the older adult unit. 

I could say so much more. The system and this place is incredibly corrupt and should be shut down or rebuilt.
